intro: Adenocalymma hosmeca, commonly known as the velvetleaf adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
